poem:
**The Morning After**  

The sun spills its frank confession  
through the blinds onto your face,  
revealing the evidence of years—  
a clumsy alchemy at work.  
  
You sip the acrid lesson from your coffee,  
counting the age in each sigh,  
as the years slip quietly into the room,  
amber ghosts with heavy heads.
